instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00850: What is 820-00850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H_RTC: What is PP3V3_G3H_RTC? PP3V3_G3H_RTC Is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..
definitions.PP3V3_UPC_TA_LDO: What is PP3V3_UPC_TA_LDO? PP3V3_UPC_TA_LDO is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing chip. When this is missing, either a capacitor on the line has shorted, PP3V3_G3H is missing, or the CD3215 is bad..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PP1V8_S3: What is PP1V8_S3? The PP1V8_S3 signal in the MacBook schematic is a power rail that provides a voltage of 1.8 volts during the S3 power state. The S3 state, often referred to as "suspend to RAM," is a low-power mode where the computer saves the session's state to RAM, allowing for quicker wake-up times compared to a full shutdown..
definitions.PP0V9_SSD0: What is PP0V9_SSD0? This is a power rail for the soldered on SSD on newer Macbooks. .
definitions.PP1V8_SSD0: What is PP1V8_SSD0? PP1V8_SSD0 is a power rail responsible for powering the soldered on NAND memory for the SSD on newer Macbook Pros.
definitions.PP1V2_AWAKE: What is PP1V2_AWAKE? The PP1V2_AWAKE signal in the MacBook schematic is a power rail that provides 1.2 volts and is associated with the machine's awake state and is used for powering the T2 chip..
definitions.PP3V_G3H_RTC: What is PP3V_G3H_RTC? PP3V_G3H_RTC is a 3v power rail present when the machine is in a G3H mechanical off state that powers the RTC circuit. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message:
very small water damage near UB300:
corrosion on:  CB300 - <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> and CB308 - <SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_TA_LDO</SIGNAL> 
replace both, all the voltage ok around UB300.
charger with battery: 20v and pulsing Amp 0A - 0.8A
charger without battery: 20V 0.04A stable.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message: Did you try DFU mode?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message:
i was came this morning I assembled the board, suddenly i sew the empty battery icon on the screen i was connected the charger but the same(dead)
i put it in DFU mode tried Revive and Restore and get the error:
GAVE UP WAITING FOR DEVICE TO TRANSITION FROM DFU STATE TO DFU STATE (4005)
there is Trackpad activity when it try install.
tried also PRAM but nothing...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message:
Do not confuse trackpad click with activity.

Did you try DFU with charger and battery, both connected?
With charger alone, do you get all AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message:
L6900 - charger alone and charger + battery 3.4V stable!
F7000 - charger alone: 12.6v-12.3v pulsing
               charger+battery: 12.8v -10v pulsing(stay at 10v for few sec and then up to 12.8v and then down to 10v and repeat.

threads.message:

Inspect and reflow <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> area.

i was reflow <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> no change.. small water damage was just on  CB300 - <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> and CB308 - <SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_TA_LDO</SIGNAL>. all the rest are very clear..
can it be  UB300?

threads.message:
All USB ports have the same behavior?
An issue located on USB-C, shouldn't stop the board to work with battery.

but dont pass the reviving.
also notice that <SIGNAL>AUD_CONN_RING2</SIGNAL>/SLEEVE full short.. should be like that?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message:
Maybe was broken/open; short (0 ohm) is its correct value!

Board still not turning on?
Check the other voltages, missing/pulsing before.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead 20v amp pulsing

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message:
"<RESISTOR>R7900</RESISTOR> was short"
Doesn't this mean 0 ohm between its pins?
How much did you expect to get for 0 ohm resistor?
By definition, a short means 0 ohm; or very-very low value in resistance mode.

If now appeared <SIGNAL>LDO_RTC</SIGNAL>, but no other above mentioned power rails, then change <CHIP>U7800</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message:
Are you sure <RESISTOR>R7900</RESISTOR> is good now (0 ohm)?
Check diode mode to ground at all small coils surrounding <CHIP>U7800</CHIP>.
Just in case, check all big coils too.
